channel.title: Getting Tools: For Creating Models
channel.description:
[font=georgia][size=14pt]Introduction:[/size][/font] Well some of you may be wondering how do you create objects/items, and the process of doing so can be found here. The links will work and none of these contain viruses or other things like that. If you have any further questions to post! [hr] [font=georgia][size=14pt]Getting your tools:[/size][/font] First off, we would need a great program that can create items or objects. This program is not as hard to use then others and its a much smaller file. It also comes with free samples to build on, or perhaps use. [b]Download link:[/b] http://www.metaseq.net/metaseq/metaseq248.zip [4.91MB - Supports Windows Vista]
Metasequoia is a polygon modeler for 3DCG and game development. It provides you efficient modeling works. It is very easy to use and learn. Even a beginner of 3DCG will be able to manage it one day. It runs on Microsoft Windows.
But that is not all you will need. You will need some programs that will convert the product you have created. [b]Download link:[/b] http://files.filefront.com/DatMakerzip/;11962142;/fileinfo.html
Datmaker can convert to or from metaseq files.
Alright, this isn't really needed, but its a tool designed to make your life easier. I suggest you download it, and don't worry - no viruses. Its just a simple Gzip. [b]Download link:[/b] http://files.filefront.com/gziprar/;11962191;/fileinfo.html
Gzip compresses files easily.
[hr] [size=14pt][font=georgia]Conclusion:[/font][/size] Those are just the files you need to create items or objects. You would have to learn yourself on how to create them - but just remember, it takes time to do this. Takes time to do anything great, but once you get it, it wouldn't take so long. Good luck!

item.title: Getting Tools: For Creating Models
item.dc:creator: @wolf_scaper wolf scaper
item.description:
@wolf_scaper wrote:

hmmm i thought you were an asshole before because you always said i couldn’t code…but i infact can…i code java way different than you because i learned it different…

i learned off of www.daniweb.com

and yes this is armadyl slayer…i made a new acc

but anyways thanks, i relly needed this…(drawing pic’s then scanning them is a drag…specially when you mess up and leave erase marks…)

ty!

-wolf scaper

item.title: Getting Tools: For Creating Models
item.dc:creator: @Rog3r Rog3r
item.description:
@Rog3r wrote:

[font=georgia][size=14pt]Introduction:[/size][/font]

Well some of you may be wondering how do you create objects/items, and the process of doing so can be found here. The links will work and none of these contain viruses or other things like that. If you have any further questions to post!

[hr]

[font=georgia][size=14pt]Getting your tools:[/size][/font]

First off, we would need a great program that can create items or objects. This program is not as hard to use then others and its a much smaller file. It also comes with free samples to build on, or perhaps use.

Download link: http://www.metaseq.net/metaseq/metaseq248.zip [4.91MB - Supports Windows Vista]

Metasequoia is a polygon modeler for 3DCG and game development. It provides you efficient modeling works. It is very easy to use and learn. Even a beginner of 3DCG will be able to manage it one day. It runs on Microsoft Windows.

But that is not all you will need.
You will need some programs that will convert the product you have created.

Download link: http://files.filefront.com/DatMakerzip/;11962142;/fileinfo.html

Datmaker can convert to or from metaseq files.

Alright, this isn’t really needed, but its a tool designed to make your life easier. I suggest you download it, and don’t worry - no viruses. Its just a simple Gzip.

Download link: http://files.filefront.com/gziprar/;11962191;/fileinfo.html

Gzip compresses files easily.

[hr]

[size=14pt][font=georgia]Conclusion:[/font][/size]

Those are just the files you need to create items or objects. You would have to learn yourself on how to create them - but just remember, it takes time to do this. Takes time to do anything great, but once you get it, it wouldn’t take so long.

Good luck!
